ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] The proper status code for conflicts
ygData.msgSnippet: How do you distinguish between a client that forgot to include if-match from one that intentionally left it off? That s rhetorical, BTW; you shouldn t. Both

Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1

How do you distinguish between a client that forgot to include if-match from
one that intentionally left it off?

That's rhetorical, BTW; you shouldn't. Both messages are perfectly valid
HTTP. If the client screwed up and sent the wrong one, that's its own fault.

Mark.

--0016e6d58bf29136f3049e9f752c
Content-Type: text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1

<p>How do you distinguish between a client that forgot to include if-match from one that intentionally left it off?</p>
<p>That's rhetorical, BTW; you shouldn't. Both messages are perfectly valid HTTP. If the client screwed up and sent the wrong one, that's its own fault.</p>
<p>Mark.</p>

--0016e6d58bf29136f3049e9f752c--
